meanings.definition: The act of instilling an idea or habit through persistent instruction or repetition.
meanings.sent1: Her inculcations of kindness and empathy have made a big impact on the students.
meanings.sent2: Teachers use inculcations to help students learn important values.
meanings.sent3: The inculcations of good manners were so effective that even the pets started behaving politely.
meanings.sent4: His inculcations of honesty were like seeds planted in fertile soil, growing strong and true.
meanings.sent5: The inculcations of hard work and dedication echoed through the halls of the school.

meanings.definition: The process of teaching or impressing something upon the mind.
meanings.sent1: Through inculcations, the students grasped the concept easily.
meanings.sent2: Effective inculcations can lead to long-lasting learning.
meanings.sent3: The inculcations of math formulas turned into a fun game for the students.
meanings.sent4: Her inculcations of creativity sparked a wildfire of ideas in the classroom.
meanings.sent5: The inculcations of history facts painted vivid pictures in the students' minds.
